articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Social media’s role in spreading coronavirus misinformation
articles.description: Social media has fueled the spread of misinformation about the coronavirus. Tanya Basu, a senior reporter covering humans and technology at MIT Technology Review, joined CBSN AM to talk about the scope of the problem.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Japanese official defends country's quarantine of cruise ship
articles.description: As of Wednesday, 621 people on the Diamond Princess cruise ship had been diagnosed with the new coronavirus.
articles.content: Japan has been criticized by some medical experts who say their quarantine of a cruise ship with confirmed cases of the new coronavirus led to a further spread of the virus. But one of Japan's top health officials said he has documents from the Ministry of He… [+2112 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Officials are using lessons from past outbreaks to fight coronavirus
articles.description: When a deadly virus arrives in the U.S., health officials follow a road map.
articles.content:
The coronavirus outbreak is still spreading around the world, with Iran confirming its first two cases overnight. 
CBS News chief medical correspondent Dr. Jon LaPook has been at the frontlines covering other infectious disease emergencies around the world. … [+3493 chars]

articles.author: Christopher Brito
articles.title: Coronavirus kills Chinese film director and his family
articles.description: "Farewell to those I love and to those who loved me!" film director Chang Kai reportedly wrote in goodbye note.
articles.content: A Chinese film director has died from the coronavirus in Wuhan, the epicenter of the virus outbreak — reportedly after nursing other members of his family who died of the disease. Chang Kai, a director at Hubei Film Studios, died at a hospital in the locked-d… [+1415 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: What can past infectious disease outbreaks teach us about the coronavirus?
articles.description: The coronavirus outbreak is still spreading around the world, with Iran confirming its first two cases overnight. What can past infectious disease outbreaks teach us about the coronavirus? Chief Medical Correspondent, Dr. Jon Lapook reports.

articles.author: Aimee Picchi
articles.title: Coronavirus economic hit could exceed $1 trillion
articles.description: Companies from Apple to Puma say outbreak is hurting sales, but economists warn the toll could be much steeper.
articles.content:
As the coronavirus outbreak widens, a range of technology, apparel and other companies say the mass epidemic and public lockdown in China is hurting their sales. But that could be only the beginning of the economic fallout, experts warn.

articles.title: Eye Opener at 8: More people released from coronavirus quarantine
articles.description: A look back at what we've been covering on "CBS This Morning."

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: More cruise passengers test positive for virus as deaths top 2,000
articles.description: Hundreds of passengers stuck for weeks on the coronavirus-plagued Diamond Princess in Japan are finally getting their freedom, even as dozens more test positive.
articles.content: There were more than 75,000 people infected with the new coronavirus disease as of Wednesday morning, and it has killed more than 2,000. The vast majority of all cases are in China, but even as Japan lifted the quarantine on a cruise ship with the biggest out… [+1480 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Japan coronavirus cruise ship quarantine lifted
articles.description: "A quarantine has ended onboard a cruise ship docked in Japan. Hundreds of passengers have been allowed to leave the ship, where more than 600 other people have gotten sick, and 79 people have confirmed coronavirus cases. "
